de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.control

Class CommandConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.control.CommandConnection

  • public class CommandConnection
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is able to both send and receive commands.

    To receive commands with it, you must call start() to start listening.

    When you want to send commands with it, you need to configure the remote host using setRemote(InetAddress, int) first. Then you can use sendCommand(AbstractCommand) to send any AbstractCommand subclass.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  CommandConnection.CommandListener
      The CommandConnection.CommandListener class is used to listen to incoming commands.

      The CommandListener is responsible for listening to incoming commands
      private java.net.InetAddress mRemoteHost
      This host should receive the outbound commands
      private int mRemotePort
      This is the discoveryPort where outbound commands should arrive at mRemoteHost

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandConnection

        public CommandConnection(OnCommandListener listener,
                         ExceptionListener exceptionListener)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        New control connection. The local listening port can be retrieved using getLocalPort() after calling start(). The remote host and port may be set using setRemote(InetAddress, int), commands can then be sent there using sendCommand(AbstractCommand)
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that will be notified of new commands arriving at this CommandConnection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getLocalPort

        public int getLocalPort()
        Retrieve the port this command connection is listening on

      • setRemote

        public void setRemote(java.net.InetAddress host,
                      int port)
        Assigns a new remote target for commands
        Parameters:
        host - host identification of the remote
        port - port the remote is listening on

      • setRemote

        public void setRemote(NetworkDevice device)
               throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Assigns a new remote target for commands
        Parameters:
        device - remote device. Must have address and commandPort configured!
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the address was invalid

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand(AbstractCommand command)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Use this function to send a command to the peer. It will assert that setRemote(InetAddress, int) has been used.
        Parameters:
        command - this command will be received by the peer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - some I/O error. A ConnectException with ECONNREFUSED and ETIMEDOUT may also be thrown.

      • isRunningAndConfigured

        public boolean isRunningAndConfigured()
        Check whether the connection is running and configured
        Returns:
        true if the connection is listening and configured with a remote

      • close

        public void close()
        Use this to gracefully stop operations

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Use this to start listening for commands. Does not throw if called multiple times.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the port for command listening could not be bound

      • onCommand

        private void onCommand(java.net.InetAddress origin,
                       AbstractCommand command)
        Called whenever our CommandListener receives a command packet.
        Parameters:
        origin - the host which sent the command
        command - the command we received

      • setRemotePort

        public void setRemotePort(int remotePort)
        Immediately change the port to which commands will be sent
        Parameters:
        remotePort - the new command port
